title: 108_hr3052
content: The Act titled "State Accountability and Identity Fraud Elimination Act of 2004" allows for the withholding of funds for the enactment of a law that permits the issuance of identification cards or driver's licenses for certain individuals. The "State Accountability and Identity Fraud Elimination Act of 2004" permits withholding funds from states that enact laws allowing issuance of identification cards or driver's licenses for specific individuals. The Secretary will withhold increasing percentages of apportioned funds for fiscal years 2006, 2007, and 2008 if the state enacts the specified law. The Secretary will withhold increasing percentages of apportioned funds for fiscal years 2009, 2010, and thereafter if a State enacts a law described in paragraph (7) by specified dates. The Secretary will withhold funds from States that issue identification cards or driver's licenses to unauthorized aliens. Funds withheld before September 30, 2007, will remain available for three fiscal years, but funds withheld after that date will not be available for apportionment. The Secretary will withhold funds from States that issue identification cards or driver's licenses to unauthorized aliens. If a State repeals the law, the withheld funds will be apportioned back to the State and will remain available for expenditure for three fiscal years. Any unobligated funds at the end of the period will lapse. If funds withheld from States for issuing identification cards to unauthorized aliens are not apportioned back due to failure to repeal the law, they will lapse. A conforming amendment is made to the chapter's analysis. Withholding of funds for implementing a law allowing issuance of identification cards or drivers' licenses for certain individuals.
